description: On 24 July, Taoiseach Micheál Martin and Minister for Education Norma Foley announced that schools in the Republic of Ireland are expected to fully reopen before the end of August. The plan, worth €375m (£342m), was announced on Monday evening and will fund an additional 1,000 post-primary teachers. The money will also fund the building of new school premises to allow for social distancing and 120 extra counselling posts to help students adjust to a different educational environment. A €75m (£68.5m) building package will be used to alter buildings and classrooms. Minister for Education Norma Foley said children in the first four years of primary school would not need to social distance, but beyond that age there would be a one-metre distance between pupils. She said there would also be "enhanced cleaning and hand hygiene" support for schools and opportunities for them to receive Personal Protective Equipment.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
